body: Anton, You are flattening the testPts input, which needs the tree branch structure to read in the results correctly.  Here is what you need to change to get results: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/uvlWa4NsIlBM4odIZqFjFd9D299nfovn6p-7549VDrutDuDNjweJekit49boErbpA-S*XXS0CdBkqqEYUFlFoqX8pQHUPxDn/CorrectDaylight2.JPG) Also, in the vein of what Abraham mentioned, you did not connect the ptsVectors to the ReadAnnualResult I component, which help tell the component understand the direction it should be looking for daylight results if not directly above (0,0,1).  Connecting this can ensure correct results for more diverse geometric cases: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/uvlWa4NsIlBmNylwp5iLKKzVuQz7Ixu8rl5O2drri**bSLmETqw2lU95LvcjUJWTTpKBeVl5fCISYpEZerDSNnLGYVd4b91i/CorrectDaylight.JPG) Mostapha put up a few annual daylight examples and I suggest checking these to answer your questions more quickly in the future: [https://hydrashare.github.io/hydra/index.html?keywords=Annual%20Day...](https://hydrashare.github.io/hydra/index.html?keywords=Annual%20Daylight) -Chris
